item.title: Trump calls for 'immediate negotiations' on Greenland, but rules out using force
item.description: President Donald Trump called for "immediate negotiations" with Denmark to "discuss the acquisition of Greenland by the United States."

item.title: European lawmakers suspend U.S. trade deal amid Greenland tariff tensions
item.description: EU lawmakers have suspended the approval of the U.S.-EU trade agreement over President Trump's Greenland-related tariff threats.

item.title: Supreme Court hears arguments on Trump bid to fire Fed Governor Lisa Cook
item.description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell planned to attend the oral arguments at the Supreme Court.

item.title: Trump says U.S. must 'get Greenland,' swipes at Europe in winding Davos speech
item.description: Trump said over the weekend that he would slap tariffs on imports from eight European countries in retaliation for moving troops to Greenland.

item.title: Greenland should be prepared for 'everything,' prime minister says, not ruling out U.S. military action
item.description: While the scenario is unlikely, Greenland has to be prepared as "the other side" has not ruled out the use of military force.
